intro: Henckelia codonion, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Henckelia codonion thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests.
